subject: Perl // Outreachy
header: TPRF has been associated with the Outreachy program for sometime. I have followed the annual program very closely in recent times. I noticed it is helping young fresh bloods getting into open source from Indian subcontinent. I know for sure, there are plenty of scope to bring in young students into Perl fold. Unfortunately it is not tapped with focussed program yet. I really want to do something to bring Perl back to dicussion table among freshers. I know I have slowdown a bit in recent time because of health issues but I still have the same energy.

For the first time, I have submitted my pet project The Weekly Challenge for the next Outreachy program. I am hoping to see some fresh talents coming forward and work with us. Looking forward to mentor and share my experience. I just wish the process was a bit simpler. May be, it is my first time, I find it harder to follow through. My advice to all newcomers stay focussed and work towards your goal taking one step at a time. Don't forget to enjoy the journey while learning. It would make a big difference, trust me.
Look after your health and stay happy, specially your mental health.

entries.title: This Week in PSC (138)
entries.text: Another week another update. Thank you Perl Steering Council for all the hard work.

entries.title: CFP: Science Track Papers Needed at The Perl & Raku Conference
entries.author: oodler
entries.text: It is time to submit your ideas for next comference in the Science Track. Don't miss the deadline, please.

chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. We pick one champion at the end of the month from all of the contributors during the month.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks: "Banking Day Offset" and "Line Parser". If you are new to the weekly challenge, why not join us and have fun every week? For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 259

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Count Even Digits Number" and "Sum of Values" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 258

entries.author: ali
entries.text: Compact one liner in Perl, very umpressive. You must check it out.
entries.title: TWC258

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Line by line code details with links to original documentation. What else do we need? Keep it up great work.
entries.title: Even Sum

entries.author: barroff
entries.text: In depth analysis is the highlight, enough to keep you engaged. Well done.
entries.title: All about digits

entries.author: bob_lied
entries.text: Clever use of regex power of Perl. Good job and thanks for sharing the knowledge with us.
entries.title: How do I sum thee? Let me count the ones.

entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Checkout thr power of grep and map but we can't underestimate sprintf. Good job.
entries.title: No Mental Bandwidth For A Name

entries.author: jaldhar_vyas
entries.text: Raku one liner is flexing its muscle this time. To be honest, it looks elegant. Thank you for sharing.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 258

entries.author: jorg_sommrey
entries.text: Love the use of CPAN to get the job done. Nice and clean implementation, well done.
entries.title: Sum Even Bits

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Get the bonus Julia solution. The perl and Raku solutio looks near identical.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 258: Count Even Digits Numbers

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Raku method chaining is my favourite. You get to see in abundance. Thank you for your contributions.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 258: Sum of Values

entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Incredibly compact and elegant solutions in Raku. Highly recommended.
entries.title: arrays of sums

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: The inhouse master of Perl one-liner is once again showing the cool side of the language.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 258

entries.author: packy_anderson
entries.text: A very different and unique approach to get the job done. Comparison with Python is really nice.
entries.title: Even Digits have a Sum!

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: This is what you get when you use all the magic from the Perl book. You get handy interface to play with it.
entries.title: All about the way numbers are written

entries.author: robbie_hatley
entries.text: I am amazed how handy CPAN module can be at times. Very impressed with the end result. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge #258

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: Nice to see Python magic being discussed in detail. So much to learn from other languages. Great work.
entries.title: Valuing the Count

entries.author: simon_green
entries.text: Python is the lucky one gets all the limelight. Elegant one-liner in Python. Cool.
entries.title: Weekly Challenge 258

entries.author: stephen_lynn
entries.text: You don't want to miss the opportunity to see how Perl4 would be handy. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: PWC 258

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
